Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • Function

  • public abstract class Function
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements sublcasses with different ways to find the root of functions between two given numbers and an a certain amount of error (in this case epsilon).
    Since:
    2/13/2018

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double epsilon
      epsilon is the amount of error that is acceptable in our answers.

      This method provides the math behind any method passed through to find a specified root of any given sin, cos, or polynomial

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract double evaluate(double x)
        Abstract method provides implementations for what we will use when using findRoot()
        Parameters:
        x - The value that we will evaluate for whatever function is implemented
        Returns:
        double This will return the value of the function implemented at its specified value

      • findRoot

        public double findRoot(double a,
                       double b,
                       double epsilon)
        This method provides the math behind any method passed through to find a specified root of any given sin, cos, or polynomial
        Parameters:
        a - The first boundary of area
        b - The second boundary of area
        epsilon - The amount of acceptable error
        Returns:
        Specified root after being passed in.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method which makes use of the findRoot method
        Parameters:
        args - Unused
        Throws:
        IOException - On input error
        See Also:
        IOException
